[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 127]
Reasoning: **Current Shop Evaluation**

Okay, let's take stock. Ante is 6/8, round 12, and it's the SHOP phase. I've got $5 in the bank. My Joker situation is: Ancient Joker (Clubs multiplier), two Hanging Chads (retrigger), Smeared Joker (suit matching), and Stuntman (chips and hand size penalty). Max Jokers is at 5, but, I have a *Negative* 8 Ball in the shop, which means I can go to 6 total Jokers, and is free.

The shop also has an Abstract Joker, for $4, which gives +3 Mult per Joker. I also have some Vouchers, Planet Merchant, Hone, Reroll Surplus.

The Negative Tag is already used, so I know I got a good value 8 Ball. The 8 Ball (Negative) is great; a free Joker slot and a chance at Tarot cards when I play an 8. This is perfect for my build, which seems to revolve around Ancient Joker and Stuntman. The Abstract Joker provides +15 Mult.

Given that I have a full Joker board, the Negative 8 Ball is an immediate buy, no question. It's free, adds a slot, and potentially gives me Tarot cards.

Now, if I buy the 8 Ball first, I'll have 6 Jokers and the Abstract Joker will then give me +18 Mult. But is that better than saving for interest, or a better Joker in a future shop? It's worth considering.

The boss is "The Window" which debuffs Hearts and I have Ancient Joker set to clubs. I'm seeing 8's in the deck so the 8 Ball has even more value now.

Okay, so the immediate action is clear: `buy_card` at position 1, which is the Negative 8 Ball. It costs $0, so it's an easy win. After that I have $5, and can re-evaluate. I'll buy that 8 Ball, see what the board looks like, then decide on that Abstract Joker or saving for Reroll Surplus, which is at the same price. `action`: "buy_card", `positions`: \[1].

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
